info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 19 at 8:10PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of west central Mercer, Louisa, western Cedar, eastern Johnson, eastern Washington, southwestern Jones, western Muscatine and southeastern Linn Counties through 900 PM CDT... At 810 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Springville to Wyman. Movement was east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Mount Vernon, Lisbon, Springville and Whittier around 815 PM CDT. Viola around 820 PM CDT. Columbus Junction, Columbus City, Martelle and Stone City around 825 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Anamosa, Morley, Wapello, Letts, Olin, Grandview, Fruitland and Center Junction. This includes Interstate 80 in Iowa between mile markers 245 and 268. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
